Flatterline is a kick ass web application development company that assists startups in their first phase(s) of development.We work closely with startups to help move from concept to reality. Whether the goal is having something to pitch to investors or sell to potential customers, we help startups choose the right set of features to meet their goals and implement them within their timeframe.We're passionate and dedicated to helping startups succeed.

A few poignant questions and he’ll come back with an elegant solution that will blow your socks off. He makes what can appear to be insurmountable, seem easy. As a designer and project manager that quality makes him an invaluable asset to my company and clients. I would highly recommend Curtis and Velocity Labs to anyone with development work, interested in the start-up community, and more.

summary: I'm a Ruby on Rails developer and startup junkie. I'm logical and detail-oriented, so software development fits me pretty well. However, I also enjoy sharing my knowledge with others through teaching and mentoring.My company began with the goal of helping startups create their vision, but found that the Phoenix startup community was fragmented, at best. So, we began organizing events geared toward entrepreneurship (e.g., OpenCoffee Club, Startup Drinks and Startup Weekend) in order to draw out the nascent startup community.Since that time, the startup community has strengthened and I now concentrate on helping local startups create their vision, in addition to building products of my own.Specialties: Ruby, Ruby on Rails, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, web application development, API development.
